p: Selection pressure on the HA, NA and PB2 genes was investigated by estimating the ratio of non-synonymous to synonymous nucleotide substitutions ( ω = d N /d S) using codon-based phylogenetic methods implemented in CODEML (available in the PAML package [18]). Likelihood ratio tests (LRTs) were used to test whether model M1a of neutral evolution (sites restricted to 0< ω<1) or model M2a of positive selection (allows sites with ω >1) was a statistically better fit to the data [45]. If the null model M1a was rejected in preference of M2a, a Bayes Empirical Bayes method was used to identify individual codons under positive selection [19]. In addition, positively selected sites were detected using the single-likelihood ancestor counting (SLAC), the random effect likelihood (REL), and the fixed effect likelihood (FEL) methods [20] via the Datamonkey website [37].
